oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1949-11-19 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry show from November 19, 1949. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Red Foley (host, performer) and the Cumberland Valley Boys (performers), Judy Martin (performer), Rod Brasfield (performer), Little Jimmy Dickens (performer), Hank Williams (performer), Minnie Pearl (performer), and Roy Acuff (performer). Transcribed from Rhein-Main Air Base, Frankfurt, Germany. Part 2: http://cmfdigitization.cmf.int:2011/cdm/ref/collection/musicaudio/id/622
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Cumberland Valley Boys; Rod Brasfield; Judy Martin
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Tennessee Saturday Night (Red Foley) -- Opening statement (Red Foley) -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Red Foley) -- Prince Albert commercial (Red Foley, Grant Turner) -- Red Foley introduces Judy Martin -- Jealous Heart (Judy Martin) -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Red Foley) -- Where Could I Go But To The Lord (Red Foley and the Cumberland Valley Boys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Rhein-Main Air Base (Germany); Turner, Grant; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Cumberland Valley Boys; Martin, Judy, 1918-1951; Brasfield, Rod; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Minnie Pearl; Acuff, Roy
